Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: priscilla47
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Suites Magnificent Mile many times. It is about two blocks off the MM at Delaware and Mies Van der Rohe. The rooms are suites (as you can guess) and that is very nice. The rooms are comfortable and clean. They have two HD TVs in each suite. I have two, well three, well, four quibbles. 1) The internet is not reliable, particularly in the meeting rooms. I know they have upgraded it in the hotel because when I was there in November, I couldn't pick it up in my room and when I called the help number he actually advised me to try going into the hall to see if I could get it there. In my jammies? I think not. It was definitely better this time around, but still frustrating. 2) My second quibble is that on the morning of my departure, housekeeping came into my room and made up the bed and the bathrooms before I had checked out. I found this inappropriately intrusive. I still, for example, wanted to wash up and the used soaps had been thrown out. I ended up spreading a bath towel on the bed so that I could put my suitcase there to pack without messing up the linens. I had also assumed no one would enter the room and so I had left things out that I would normally have locked up. 3) I used the fitness center and neither of the televisions on two treadmills I tried worked nor did the heart rate monitors. The television on the recumbent cycle had so few channels and most were ESPN. Again, frustrating. 4) Fourth quibble, which is just insane, I know, but I really cringe at the upholstery on the sofa in the living room. It's straight up ugly and every time I check in, I hope that someone would have the good sense to change it, but sadly, no. The colors/rugs/drapes/etc. etc. are all quite lovely, but lordy, I do not like the sofa. All in all though, I like this hotel a lot. It's convenient, comfortable, a good value, the restaurant has yummy food, the bar mixes nice drinks. I keep going back, but still, I wish they'd reupholster!

Reviews.Title: “College Tours”
Reviews.Author: Steamplay
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son who was auditioning at Northwestern and visiting other colleges in the Chicago area. The hotel was very reasonable, the front desk was helpful in making sure we got our non-smoking, double bed suite. The only thing to watch out for is that the valet parking is $51. I parked around the corner in a lot from one of the apartment buildings and saved money. Starbucks in the lobby, breakfast was quite good, but typical hotel restaurant prices. The location was fabulous. I will stay again when in Chicago if the rates stay the same!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MLJ_03936
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location on the Mag Mile in Chicago. CLose to shopping, restaurants and other cultural attractions. Rooms are large, very clean, modern and quiet. Staff was always willing to assist with whatever we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TracyUsa
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 2 times now and both times we were very pleased with the hotel. Great location, clean and comfortable, very large rooms and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great family staycation destination”
Reviews.Author: javakai13
Reviews.Content: We could tell from the pool others had also decided upon the Hilton Suites for their long weekend getaway. You can't beat the location, staff gave us a great room for my birthday, very attentive and helpful when we wanted to extend our stay. Only complaint is with the pool - it started looking a little dirty by the evening, so not sure what the pool cleaning schedule is like. Kids enjoyed it and we'll definitely visit a 3rd time in the future. And the sofa bed was a little broken. but still functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great local”
Reviews.Author: Mammo64
Reviews.Content: So well located it is easy to overlook flaws. Restaurant is not the best but ok. Fitness center tvs need to be fixed so you get more than ESPN or TBS. Staff are friendly Living room couch is the pits and they need to at least give you a plate and cutlery since they have a fridge and microwave but that is minor. So close to walk to everything. if they had a lounge for members I would overlook every picky thing

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mwh31
Reviews.Content: This is a block from the miracle mile. Great bus connections. It is a small suite. There is microwave, small fridge. Two desks (although there is no light on the desk in the bedroom). Very happy with it. Nice restaurant downstairs. Starbucks also in lobby for quick snack.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeninthechi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right behind the John Hancock Center, and a block away from Water Tower Place where the new American Girl store is, so it can't be beat location wise if those are on your list. We booked a King suite, our Gold HHonors status got us a free 'upgrade', to a lake view room on the 27th floor. If you are considering paying extra for one of these rooms, don't. The view is mainly of several residential towers, and we could see what one guy was grilling on his balcony at one point. The room itself was clean, but the wear is starting to show. Yellowing switch plates, peeling wall paper, toothpaste stains on the mirror frame etc. The 'king' bed (we have one at home, this was not a king size bed) was comfortable, and we slept well. The sofa sleeper was pretty lumpy and I doubt an adult would be comfortable, but our kids were ok with it. The staff were however quick to respond when we found our safe had not been left unlocked by the previous guest, and when we needed a new hair dryer because the old one was broken. We didn't eat here, the prices for breakfast were a little ridiculous ($14 for a coffee and a Danish?!). We also didn't park here because $55 per day is frankly extortionate, the John Hancock building where Oprah lives charges less. Next time we're staying in Chicago I'll pay the extra $25 and stay at the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Views!”
Reviews.Author: Babycakesk
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few nights here with my husband. Had a beautiful, large corner room complete with stunning views of the lake! Used the fitness center every morning & jogged while looking straight at the John Hancock building. Fantastic! Ate lunch at the hotel restaurant & had a phenomenal beet salad! SO delicious! Front desk upon arrival was very personable & friendly. Concierge recommended Michael Jordan's Steakhouse for us 1 evening being that we were interested in steak. Best filet I've ever had! Close to shopping & Magnificent Mile!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjohn
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms and located well just a stone's throw from the Hancock building. Quick check in, excellent water pressure, has fridge and microwave. Why pay $50+ more for the original Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean place.”
Reviews.Author: Pearl C
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly staff. Bed is always comfortable, with clean and spacious rooms and bathroom. Nice to have a separate room to watch tv with a couch, table. The property itself is in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Great Location, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Suites on the Magnificent Mile is a solid, very good hotel. There is nothing flashy or â€œboutique-likeâ€� here. The hotel is outfitted with your standard, run-of-the-mill Hilton hotel interiors, business center, and pool / gym. However, what makes this hotel desirable is its ideal location, room size, and being an all â€œsuiteâ€� hotel, the bedroom is separate, and closed off by solid doors from the rest of the room. You can count on a quiet, good nightâ€™s sleep here. The service is also very good here. The staff are pleasant and responsive. Worth mentioning also are the pool and gym, which are located at the top of the property with commanding views of Lake Michigan and downtown Chicago. Also, the hotel seems to fill up with families and children on the weekends â€¦ fortunately, we didnâ€™t have to deal with early morning, residual hallway noise since the bedroom was separate and an ample distance from the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Many more pluses than minuses”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCook
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was quite friendly, helpful and attentive. The correct room was available on our arrival, and the room seemed clean, bright, and well appointed. It was also a fairly spacious room. Even though it was close to the elevator, the room was quiet. My father, my brother and I shared a room with two "doubles" (felt like queen-size) and a pullout couch. The room has a small wet bar which includes a sink, a refrigerator, a microwave (stored underneath, oddly) and a two-cup coffee maker (which was inoperative on our arrival but quickly replaced). The thermostat is near the window in the pullout-couch room, and had to be turned up to nearly 80F to achieve a comfortable temperature - a design/installation flaw the maintenance person assured me. Also, between the two rooms are double doors with ball catches at the top. One door did not have this catch - maintenance informed me they did not have the part to fix it. Not a huge deal but a little odd. The only somewhat major drawback was my brother reported (as have others) that the pullout was very uncomfortable. I cannot personally report on it as I did not sleep there. (Hey, I was paying for the room, I was sleeping in a real bed!) The doubles were really quite comfortable, on the other hand. Wired Internet didn't seem to work (the modem had been unplugged from power, but even plugged in it wouldn't connect). WiFi/Internet access wasn't free anyway. At a downtown Hilton in a major city, having to pay for Internet access is unreasonable. (On the plus side, I discovered the 4G-LTE signal was powerful and the one-time low-cost tethering program works well.) Another very over-the-top expense was parking. We had taken a cab to the hotel, but when family came to visit they found there is no nearby parking and the valet costs $35.00 for between 2-6 hours. (I think it was $27.00 for 0-2 hours and something like $50 for beyond 6 hours.) The family lives in town and said the cost was beyond the pale. Returning to the positives, there is an unsurprisingly expensive coffee shop which has a few snacks and serves Starbucks coffees. There is also a restaurant which I will review here as well, which is really quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room to spread out to work or relax.”
Reviews.Author: Kowalisyn
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious. It had a sitting room/office with a tv, microwave, small refrigerator, and sink in a separate bar area. The sleeping room had a separate dressing area. The bathroom was a very nice size with 2 doors, one to the sitting room and one to the sleeping area. There were double doors dividing the sitting from sleeping area. The sleeping area had its own tv also. This hotel is in a fabulous location... close to shopping at Bloomingdale's and Water Tower Place; around the corner from the Drake or the Hancock Center. It is only blocks from Lake Shore drive. You can watch the sun come up over Lake Michigan from the fitness center! Many good restaurants surround this hotel and they do have a coffee shop, bar, and restaurant on site. The only thing I would say is that the bed were too soft for my taste and for some reason our room was a little cold, but it was unusually cold the few days we stayed in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Liliwhatever
Reviews.Content: We stayed there mid-August for 5 nights. Just for a couple, the room is very big, with a good king bed. We can make shopping and eat in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SueinCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid-January for 3 nights, my husband and I and our two teenage kids. The location is really great - it is a good place to be in order to get to food/activities close by. The rooms are pretty small, which was a little bit hard with 4 of us, but we were only in the room to go to bed or rest for an hour or so before heading off again. Beds were not the most comfortable I have ever had. The hotel does not offer rollaway beds. We had to request extra pillows and blankets, which were brought up right away and we then had plenty for all of us. We only had 3 towels for 4 guests. Kind of odd. We never got around to asking for more. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was very convenient. We did not eat at the restaurant at the hotel, so no feedback there. We walked to dinner 2 of 3 nights, so very convenient to restaurants. There are shopping centers inside some of the nearby buildings, so if you are looking for a snack or lunch, etc, you can check out what is there (like in the building where Macy's is). The hotel is very close to Michigan, which has many wonderful shops if you want to do some shopping. Overall, the hotel is good for families and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: WKYtraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property twice and had a great experience both times. Right on the Mag Mile and steps from the Gold Coast. Train station is a short walk. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Stop by the Concierge desk to pick up a "what's happening" list as well as sightseeing and dining opportunities and discounts. The suite set up lets mom and dad have a separate room from the kids. Fridge and microwave in the room are a plus. Even if you don't swim or work-out you should go to the pool level for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: kjtravelingmomof2
Reviews.Content: We have an 8-month old and a daughter turning 4. We chose this hotel because we always stay at Hilton hotels and because of the close proximity to American Girl. The service is fantastic. The restaurant breakfast is delicious. It's a very short stroll to American Girl & all other great shopping places. Additionally, there is a market right across the street, which was really convenient when I realized I didn't bring anything to wah bottles with. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great for families”
Reviews.Author: Tootuff2
Reviews.Content: Location could not get any better for the price. Had a lakeview room and a lot of room for it. Comes with microwave, frig, and coffee maker. Sofa in second Room turns into a comfortable bad (for a pull out). We were close to the elevators so it was a littlE noisy when people were waiting for it. The gym was beautifiul but there are a lot of kids running around. I'll be back when I have kids, but for a romantic weekend for 2, I would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: dakkinni
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my mother for a shopping weekend. This hotel is one block from Water Tower. We checked in and left our bags in the room and was shopping within 10 minutes. The price was reasonable for the location and the room was nice. Two queen beds in one room and sofa with TV in another. I would say it was above average, but not fancy. The rooms were much bigger than the Knickerbocker with is right next door and the price was cheaper. I made the right choice and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Room Request Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: bmsAppleton
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, my room request could not be honored. Instead of two double beds, I got a King suite with a pull-out couch. The couch's mattress was so poor that you could feel the springs. Put the couch back together, and couldn't sleep on that because it was too short and not deep enough. Had to sleep on a terrible couch mattress instead, feeling the springs all night. I don't understand Chicago Law. The hotels in Chicago tell me that they cannot honor my reservations because other guests have extended their stay. I guess the law dictates that they cannot remove somebody from their room once they check-in. This is my second consecutive stay in Chicago with hotel problems supposedly due to this law. (two different hotels). They did give us a free breakfast and 10,000 Hilton Honors Points. However, a comfortable stay was what I was paying for, not the freebies. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Small suites but big on customer service”
Reviews.Author: opti360
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel & rooms. Loved the pool: warm, decent size and an incredible view of Lake Michigan. Great fitness room & hours are perfect. Great location just a block off of Mag Mile. Super close to More & Sprinkles Cupcakeries along with Williams & Sonoma. We recommend this highly and this will be the only place we stay in Chicago for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable, good-value hotel in one of Chicago's priciest 'hoods”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: Amidst the expensive apartment towers and designer stores of downtown Chicago's Gold Coast sits the Hilton Suites, a very nice place to bed down after a day or night prowling the Windy City. The hotel is in a relatively nondescript tower at Mies van der Rohe and Delaware, a block from N. Michigan Avenue and the John Hancock building. It features a relatively small, attractive and placid lobby. The front-desk staff is pleasant and efficient. But the rooms are what make this place such a good value for the money. The standard room is not really a suite, but sort of a mini-suite. The cozy sleeping area is separated from the spacious sitting area, which features a couch, cocktail. lounger and work desk, as well as a bar area with a mini-fridge, microwave, sink and coffee service (which has Lavazza coffee and actual liquid creamer!). My bedroom featured an uber-comfortable king bed that I didn't want to crawl out of on a cold Chicago morning. It also contained a vanity area. And though the rooms won't win any contests for edgy design, the soothing earth tones and comfortable furnishings will be a welcome sight for a tired traveler. The spacious bathroom (with excellent shower pressure and Peter Thomas Roth bath products) could be accessed from the bedroom or the sitting room. Both the bedroom and sitting room featured flat-screen TVs, though the channel selection was rather limited. With so much good grub in Chicago, I didn't bother with the hotel restaurant or room service, which was typically overpriced. There's also a little lobby shop that serves Starbucks coffee. As with most downtown chain hotels, just about any service in the hotel is a la carte, including wired and wireless internet service, as well as access to the business center. So when I needed to boot up, I found a nice little independent coffee house on the north side where the WiFi came free with a soy latte. The Hilton Suites is a block from the north end of the Mag Mile, close to Bloomingdales and the Water Tower Place shopping center. Nearby restaurants include Gaylord India and the Cheesecake Factory. Price-wise, you could spend a lot more and get a lot less than the Hilton Suites. I got a sensational rate of $53 per night via a Priceline bid, and even the rates on the Hilton website, or Orbitz, Expedia etc., compare favorably with other hotels of its quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all around”
Reviews.Author: Pilar1978
Reviews.Content: While I travel to Chicago frequently, I had never previously stayed at the Hilton Suites. I got an excellent deal so thought to give it a try. The hotel is conveniently located just off of Michigan Avenue, and if you enjoy the shopping around the Hancock and Water Tower Place you'll find the location superb. The hotel is busy, but spacious, and check-in was a breeze. My husband and I were assigned a room at the end of the hallway behind the elevators. While other reviewers found the elevator noises bothersome, I did not really notice them (unless in the bath which was directly behind the elevators) - if this troubles you ask for a suite away from the elevators at check-in. The room itself was large and clean - bed was great - nice view of the Hancock building - no complaints! We parked elsewhere - the valet parking is over $50 a day, so you can definitely find a cheaper place to park if you drive around a bit. L is a few blocks down, along with TONS of restaurants and coffee places. It is also an easy walk down to the river and the Christkindl market if that strikes your fancy. All in all a great stay; I'd happily recommend this hotel to others, especially if you can find a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Advocates
Reviews.Content: The Staff went the extra mile to accommodate my needs. Samuel, the valet, had my car available each morning without reminders and the front office and bell staff was just as exceptional. My wife enjoyed the convenience to shopping on the magnificent mile and was able to return to the hotel multiple times with bags and bags of Christmas presents rather than carry them throughout her day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DYGARTINI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a long business trip. It should be a pleasant stay if I did not encounter the following : 1. unpleasant staff at the front office who are arrogant and impolite. The hotel should terminate this kind of people if they want to maintain their business. 2. have to send my laundry to the front office, instead of housekeeping comes and collect it from my room 3. additional room charges were charge to my credit card without my authorization, after I checked out!! Now I have to work out with my credit card company on the dispute. I have complained but no action was taken to call me back. This is going to be my last stay at HILTON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: estes k
Reviews.Content: We spent the Friday after Thanksgiving shopping on the Magnificent Mile and chose the Hilton Suites primarily for the price. It was the cheapest all-suites hotel and we were very surprised and impressed. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful, especially allowing us to check in early. The hotel is less than a block from Michigan Avenue which was perfect to avoid the crazy crowds and noise and only a minute or two walk from the shopping and festivites. The shower was probably the BEST shower I have every had in a hotel. The water pressure was very high, the shower and tub clean and the towels are soft. This is actually one of the nicest Hiltons that I have stayed. Two very large LG flat panel TVs in the room and plenty of channels. The only downside to the hotel is the $54.00 for valet parking so we parked a block away for $20.00. Again, the nicest staff, great location, best shower and great pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very average room.”
Reviews.Author: Eframp
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an affordable place to stay that is in the center of the action, this is it. The hotel is just blocks away from Michigan Avenue and all the big department stores. The room itself is average. We booked a suite for 3 nights and the pullout sofabed is extremely uncomfortable. The mattress on the sofabed is about 3 inches thick, and there was a bar that jammed in my back all night. For a suite which is meant to accomodate 3 people (I assume), the bathroom and main living area is extremely small. My biggest complaint is that there was no safe in the room, and we did not feel comfortable leaving our jewelry and electronics in the room while we shopped. On a positive note, the fitness center and pool is on the 30th floor, so the views are incredible, looking over Lake Michigan and downtown Chicago. There are 4 treadmills (one of which was out of order, and another made a horrible screeching sound), 3-4 ellipticals, and a stationary bike. There are also free weights and medicine balls. Good equipment and great views! Overall, if you are not planning on spending a lot of time in the hotel, this place is fine, but it is not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience, nice rooms, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Candice126
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in early november while in town for business. Overall nice experience as you would expext from a hilton. Perfect location on magnificent mile with a friendly staff, clean large rooms, and a nice gym with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, solid property”
Reviews.Author: Pedalboy
Reviews.Content: Magnificent Mile is around the corner, Rush Street just a few blocks, great restaurants, theaters - all here. Delaware is quiet, rooms are well insulated. Nice restaurant and bar on property. My suite was big but not extravagent, desk and chair were first class. I would return for business, and would happily bring my family for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location with a few issues and a big price tag”
Reviews.Author: mboileau
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to not have high expectations for this hotel when you see "Hilton", "Suites" and "Chicago Magnificent Mile". Overall, our six night stay was very good. Top kudos go to its location right off Michigan Ave with all the designer stores and across the way from the Hancock Tower with its great Rainbow Room and views. As for the suites, I'd warn you not to expect a sprawling layout. The standard suite is as large as a regular hotel room broken up into two with a wall in the middle. The king size bed in the bedroom left just enough room all the way around to walk and that's about it. There are two plasma TVs, a microwave and a fridge to give you some options other than the exhorbitently priced restaurants. My complaints? The maid forgot to clean our room the first morning. After getting back after a long day and complaining at the front desk, it still took another two hours before it was done. Just our bad luck. Next on the list is the valet only parking at $50 a night with no local public garages running much cheaper than that. I hated to cough up a lung to pay for something we hardly used while there. At check-in the bellhop misplaced one of our bags which caused a frantic search and wasted another hour. More bad luck. It was all still quite upscale and considering we offset part of the stay with reward points, the price was manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine and convenient”
Reviews.Author: shanoa
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Suites is very well located. Within walking distance from the Magnificent Mile and close to several great restaurants and shops, it's really a no-brainer. Parking is expensive, but that's true anywhere in Chicago. Rooms are clean and well-thought out.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: My stay here was as good as it gets. Beautiful hotel, excellent staff, great spacious room with a view of the lake, within a block of Michigan Ave and the Hancock building, a few blocks to the subway, great restaurants. I can't imagine what more one could ask from a hotel. There was a little glitch with the internet charges due to, I presume, multiple devices. I stayed less then 24 hours and had 3 charges on my bill the next day. The front desk person didn't even blink and eye and immediately removed 2 of them. But in this day and age of multiple devices that system should be addressed. Coming from a miserable stay the night before at a supposed 4 star hotel, I was surprised to see this one only ranked a 3.5 as it was far superior to that other one in every aspect. When I come back, this hotel will be first on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kuuru
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before; in fact for the same convention every other year. The service is always top notch. For me it's the little things, like using my name when I check in, thanking me for my HHonors loyalty...etc etc. This hotel has top notch people. My room was on a high level floor, beautiful view of the city. I love the gym in this hotel, nice equipment, spacious and overall it felt like a real gym. I did not eat in the restaurant but I did sit at the bar for a few drinks; overall great impression there. I recommend not using anything from the mini bar. You can walk to a convenience store just minutes away and pay substantialy less. I would stay here again. Great location for conventions at McCormick Place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KGod76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long birthday weekend in September. This Hotel is in a great location very close to the John Hancock center & all the shopping along Magnificent Mile. We stayed in a King Suite which includes a love seat, chair, desk, wet bar, & tv on one side and a bed, tv on another side. I really liked the setup so when one of us wanted to get up early it didnâ€™t wake the other. One morning we ordered room service & it was ok. The valet was a bit pricey. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: AR08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend when my husband had a conference and I met him with our 7 year old boys. The hotel is clean and modern. The rooms are very spacious. We got a king suite which had a bedroom with a king bed separated by a door from a living area with a sofa bed. There is also a small fridge and microwave. The location was fabulous. One short block from the JohnHancock building and Michigan ave. Easy to walk anywhere. Ask for a high level room with a view of the lake on check in and they will try to accommodate you even if you had not paid extra for it. The pool and exercise room are on the top floor and quite nice. Parking is $52! There are 2 self park lots close by which are close to 1/2 that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: miseno
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location and the rooms were recently updated with new flat-screen tvs. But the service was what made my experience; they were very accomodating, letting me check in early after my red-eye flight. The fact that the wet-bar was well-stocked was a bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with a lot of space”
Reviews.Author: SidB
Reviews.Content: We took a day trip to downtown and stay at this place with our two young kids. This is right behind the Hancock building. The rooms are modern and spacious. We had a living room and and a wet bar kitchen. The stay was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lovetootrvl
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Suites on two occasions recently. The first was for four nights and then a few days later I was back for three nights. The staff are wonderful! They always make me feel very welcome and it is like visiting friends when I return each year! The only problem that I had was with the restaurant in the hotel. We had breakfast there each morning and they always seemed "frantic" like they were surprised that people were coming to eat! We waited to be seated, we waited for our drinks and then we waited for refills. It seems like they had enough help, but no direction. Also, it was not very appetizing to watch the manager swat flys off the wall above the fruit table! YUCK! He did this on many of the mornings that I was there. I hate to recommend the Hilton Suites only because I want to keep it "my secret"!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: jrw7179
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times with our children, most recently in August 2011. The rooms are one bedroom suites with a living area that has a pull-out sofa, so mom and dad can have some privacy while the kids have their own place to sleep. The hotel is adjacent to the Hancock Tower so you're not far from everything. My only complaint is that the wireless Internet access seems awfully slow. Otherwise, we would stay here again with our children.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Shuya
Reviews.Content: Service is good, rooms are clean and spacious. Our only problem was that we booked a room for 4 adults, and they gave us a suite with one queen bed and a sofabed. So we changed rooms to one with two beds, but we were a little disappointed to find that they only offer 2 full-size beds in their suites. Every other hotel on this trip has had 2 queen-size beds in the rooms. So it was a little surprising to find that the Hilton doesn't provide that. But everything was very clean, with a cafe bar on site. There are lots of restaurants in the area. Within walking distance of navy pier and opposite the John Hancock building.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: MESWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Hilton Suites Chicago is located on the north end of Michigan Ave. It is directly across the street from the Hancock Building. The rooms are nice, updated and include the usual Hilton qualities of clean and comfortable. The staff is very courteous and helpful. I would have given the review 5 stars except for 2 things: The parking is very expensive at $52 per night. Also, if you order a drink outside on the patio during Happy Hour, they are not included unless you are inside the bar area. The outside patio is lovely though. I also like the fact they serve Starbucks drinks in the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: Peoriaguy1000
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable and large As a Hilton Diamond member, I was upgraded to the upper floor. The location of this hotel is great....about 2 blocks from the Hancock Bldg and a block from Michigan Ave. Valet parking is expensive, so I parked less than 2 blocks down the street in a secure garage for $29/night. I did have to check out a day early, and they were going to charge me a $75 early departure fee. When I told the clerk that I told the clerk at check-in that I may have to leave a day early and she said that was no problem, she didn't charge the fee. Something to keep in mind especially for business travlers as our schedules change often. Also, the breadfast included for diamond members was minimal (good quality though). I would recommend the hotel & will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: chicagolover59
Reviews.Content: Good location, fair rooms. Nothing special, but nothing terrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family who like to shop.”
Reviews.Author: tjocCanada
Reviews.Content: Rooms were good. Separate bedroom was comfortable and quiet- we upgraded to a Queen sized bed and our two daughters slept on the pull out. The upgrade also gave us a view of the lake but you could only see it over a bunch of roofs. Bell men were not the happiest group of employees but front desk, concierge and bar and restaurant staff were friendly. Hotel is located around the corner from Watertower Place as well as other shopping and within walking distance of some good restaurants. We had breakfast in the hotel both mornings we were there- food was acceptable. It was very busy both mornings but they fit us in with minimal wait.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with children - but climate control was an issue”
Reviews.Author: Januarybride01
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old son and I stayed at this property in March. We visit Chicago regularly (my husband is there every other week) and normally stay at the W. One week it was sold out, so we stayed at this property due to the price and location. I do love that there are two "rooms" and that my son had a bed and TV all to himself. The restaurant on site had great pizza. The coffee shop in the lobby was so slow that there were lines up to 10 people long which is unacceptable. The workout facility and pool were adequate. However, all that said, we will never stay there again because we literally complained for 5 days about the suffocating heat not just on our floor but also in the corridor and being told that they were sorry, they were full and there was nothing they could do. My husband probably slept about 3 hours per night on average and was so happy to go home. Major bummer. I also told the front desk that I was a Hilton Honors member but they said they could not honor it since I booked on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Humidity damaged and dangerous rooms, unenjoyable restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a few days with my two younger children. The rooms are standard hotel size, but they "cut them in half" to make a suite. It ends up being a tight experience, especially when you use the pull-out bed. The humidity in the room was noticeable. The a/c unto could not keep up with it, and it was noisy. Most disturbing is that in the bedroom, the windows are lower to to floor and open up inward toward the bed. For a family with younger children, say 2-6 years old, who may jump around on the bed, I envisioned our kids jumping up and then out the windows. Seriously, this is a poorly planned window design and a child up to about 40 pounds could easily slip through out the window. Needless to say, we kept the windows closed, and it was a stuffy, unpleasant room because of the poor ac unit. As to the rest of the room, the carpeting was worn and in need of a cleaning. Vacuuming was insufficient, so we wore our socks on the floor. Standard bath amenities. Be careful in the restaurant. They offer a breakfast buffet, but they are certainly willing to seat you 10 minutes before it is over, charge you for it, not tell you the end time, and then start cleaning it up and closing it before you finish your first plate. That was annoying. Restaurant service is exceptionally slow. They seem to have a lot of employees circling around and socializing in the restaurant, but they are not attentive to keeping the water glasses filled, and the food is average. The location of the property is very good near Michigan Ave. The pool is nice, but I think they need to work on balancing the chemicals as the water was persistently foggy. The exercise area is average, it is smaller than compared to nearby properties. Views are very good. Front desk staff very friendly. Towels and linens were more than half way through their life, somewhat worn. Overall, this is a budget-quality hotel, that is overpriced which they justify based on the location. I would probably not stay here again, mainly because the carpeting was worn and gross, and there was a lack of attention to detail such as restaurant performance and safety. In you don't need a pool, I would suggest the Westin immediately next door as I stayed there and room quality is higher especially as to carpet, bedding, linens and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only for families”
Reviews.Author: kadesh2
Reviews.Content: Essentially a family hotel. Minimal lobby, inadequate exercise room, and somewhat noisy. Suite only fairly furnished but does contain two separate rooms. There is only one bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for walking, sight-seeing or catching a taxicab”
Reviews.Author: TravelingQuilter1953
Reviews.Content: Our very clean king room was on the 28th floor. We had views of both Lake Michigan and Navy pier. We stayed here two nights, during very hot and humid weather. Our room was comfortably air-conditioned, and we had control over the settings. We picked this hotel for it's location and because it was better priced than others in this same desirable area of the city. We were happy with our choice, and would stay there again. We arrived before our room was ready. The bellhop kept track of our luggage, and the desk clerk gave us bottles of cold water. We were happy to be out of the car after a long drive, and spent our waiting time exploring the upscale neighborhood. Be forewarned: parking costs $52 a day. Other area hotels charge even more than that. The valet takes your vehicle to a covered garage. Tip: when you want to take out your car, call the valet a few minutes ahead of time, and he will have it ready for you to drive away. The mattress was comfortable, the bed linens were smooth and soft to the skin. The room had a flat screen TV on a large chest of drawers, desk and chair, love seat, coffee table, microwave, small refrigerator, and a closet with mirrored doors. There is an in-room coffee maker. Starbucks coffee and WiFi is available in the lobby snack shop. Otherwise, it costs about $10 a day to have internet connection in your room. The bathroom was clean, had plenty of towels and tissue, a hair dryer, and was stocked with wonderful Peter Thomas Roth toiletries. There was no fan in the bathroom, so we just left the door cracked a bit during showers to prevent the mirror from fogging. All encounters with hotel employees were good. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Chicago lives up to it's motto as "the city that works." Oak Street Beach is a very short walk from this hotel, and the John Hancock building is literally across the street. Michigan Avenue is a block away, with amazing shops and restaurants galore. Water Tower Place is a short walk from the hotel. My favorite restaurants were Lou Mitchell's near Union Station (for breakfast - all eggs are double-yoked, children are adored there) and Devon, a seafood restaurant not far away from the hotel. We also ate at Berghoff's, which we remembered from 30 years ago. Management has changed hands, but the classic interior looks the same, and yummy sauerbraten is still on the menu. My husband went out on the Ledge at Willis Tower (better known by it's former name: Sears Tower.) While he was there, I went to one of my favorite places on the planet - the Art Institute of Chicago. If you enjoy art museums, this will be a real treat for you. Admission was $18. On Tuesdays, admission is free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Smelly Rooms / Internet over Charge / HHonours policies not Respected !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 5 days. At our arrival, our "fully paid in advance" reservation hadn't been respected and we were given a really smelly room on the smoking floor ! After asking for another room we were given a room on the same floor and as smelly as the first one !!!! It was only after the 2nd day that the hotel finally respected our reservation but no refund or upgrade had been offered !!! Finally after our trip I received a $77 charge for the use of the Internet within the room even if we were told by the reception desk at our arrival that as HHonours members we were not going to be charged (and I am not even mentioning the poor quality of the Internet). In the end I am still waiting for the refund or in fact any kind of response from the Hilton customer service regarding the Internet charge. Until now it is still a quite disappointing experience and I would rather not recommend this Hilton location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right 2 blocks from Mag Mile!”
Reviews.Author: fromCharleston
Reviews.Content: Spacious,clean room with great view of the lake from the 22nd floor. Great location to shopping, Oak Street Beach, easy walk to the red Line for a cubs game. Was great to have a fridge and a convenience store across the street. Friendly helpful staff. One night we were too tired to go out to eat, ordered room service and were shocked at how good the steaks were. Highly recommend this location for a first visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Small Meetings”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location for some business meetings that were held within the hotel. The meeting facilities were quite nice, the food was good and the rooms were roomy and comfortable. We were able to make use of a conference room that held about 20 people and then smaller breakout rooms which held about 8 people. The hotel was quite hot but the guest rooms were just fine and comfy. The hotel bar closed on us both nights at 10:30 but other than that, I would certainly consider a return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious suite”
Reviews.Author: ChristiB50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son and his friend. We loved the location - close to the shopping they wanted, like J Crew. The staff were pleasant, the place was clean and overall it was a good experience. Even the sleeper sofa was reasonably comfortable. Many people seem to like the higher floors because of good lake views. Our room was on the 6th floor, which didn't give that option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ydnah
Reviews.Content: Hilton Suites is a GREAT place to stay in Chicago! I love the location. Very close to bus, out of hustle and bustle. Hotel front desk staff and info center was very helpful and nice. Our room was great, bed was SO COMFY! Loved the pool on the top floor, GREAT VIEW to Lake Michigan! Will be back!! Oh, and the restaurant was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: amydmod
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hilton Suites on Delaware 3 times now and each time it gets better! The location of the hotel is great because you get magnificent water views and are within walking distance to great shopping and restaurants. The rooms are very spacious and updated. Hotel staff is always helpful and accomadating.

Reviews.Title: “Average @ best. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: stownse123
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous & friendly. Rooms were very average & mostly clean. The selling point is the location. Very near lots of restaurants, shops, transportation. Nice bar/lounge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good in parts”
Reviews.Author: talkingtocactus
Reviews.Content: on the whole this wasn't a bad stay - the location of the hotel is fantastic, only a 10 min walk from Chicago L station, right by the beach, right by the hancock observatory, walgreens 2 blocks away, etc. the room was nice and large with an inner bedroom, outer room with a sofa bed, and connecting bathroom. having a mini fridge & microwave was very useful. the door/valet staff are really helpful and friendly, and the reception staff mostly the same, but there were a couple of little issues that made it less than great. one was that - for the room i was in at any rate, on the 14th floor, with a (very lovely) lake view - the room was really noisy. each morning i could hear, and got woken by, what sounded like vacuuming or similar from above, usually quite early, around 7-8 am, as well as being able to clearly hear housekeeping carts moving around in the hallways, despite having the internal door to the bedroom area of the suite closed. another slight problem i had was on check out - the bell desk man was extremely slow and when i went to leave my bags as i wanted to return for them later took several minutes to take them from one side of a small hallway to another. then when i went to retrieve them, with a train to catch, he was even slower and went from the desk to the room where they were then stopped for a chat with his colleague - i could see my bags sitting there, but couldn't get them as they were in the secure room, then he came back without the bags, then wandered back to the room to get them. it took quite a long time and i was glad i'd allowed extra time to catch the train. those issues are fairly minor though, and for me the biggest problem is one that is consistent across the hilton chain is the charge for wifi internet. i've stayed in far cheaper hotels and motels around the US and europe and almost all have provided wifi as a free service. for a chain as vast and profitable - and relatively expensive - as hilton to charge, and further to charge as much as they do ($12.95 or $16.95) seems rather petty, not to mention extortionate. it would probably cost them next to nothing to allow free access to their wifi. sadly it seems that the bigger, more expensive, and profitable a hotel chain is, the more they try to get away with with extra charges. it's not necessarily a dealbreaker but i think if they want to keep competitive it's something they should look at changing - either make it free, or charge considerably less. all that said, the hotel itself was clean, reasonably comfortable, very well placed, and a good base for a 11 day stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sdf1kks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip to the area... This hotel was in a great location, in proximity to Rush street, an easy walk across the street to the Hancock building. The halways look like any other hotel but i was pleasantly surprised by the room decor and comfort. The workout room on the high floor afforded spectacular views of the city and the pool looked onto Lake Michigan from high above. I would recomend this hotel to those with families that are touring the area becasue the location is great and you can walk to all attractions in that area.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3 out of 5 and a celebration of averageness”
Reviews.Author: Dad05
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is on the north end of Michigan Ave, next to the John Hancock Tower, The Cheesecake Factory, an easy walk to Watertower Place and Rush Street. The hotel is ok....probably a 60's era hotel. pretty clean. It is not special and I used hotel points to pay for my stay. The rates that I saw quoted on Hilton.com and Priceline were around $300/night. That would be pretty spendy for this type of averageness. Valet parking was $52/night and self park was $32/night.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would certainly choose the same again”
Reviews.Author: CristinaDK
Reviews.Content: We spent our holiday in Chicago and picked this hotel based on price/reviews on trip advisor and alike. We were there for 9 nights. The location is excellent, two minutes walk to the lakefront, same distance in opposite direction and you are on Michigan Ave. Bus stop around the corner on Michigan Ave, tourist office very close by. Agree with earlier comments regarding the sleeping sofa - terrible. It may worth investing in new ones, as most of guests seem to use the additional sleeping place. Unlike bedsheets and the rest of the room, the towels did not always seem that clean. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Great view from the pool on 30th floor ! And wonderful sunrise over the lake from our room on 16th floor. . Many people mention the convenience store accross the street - it is dark, dusty and outdated. Worth walking couple of blocks to Potash Brothers Market ( 875 N State Str) for a cleaner shop and a better sellection of food and beverages. We took the train from the airport. Did not know that there was no elevator/ escalator at Jackson st when changing to red line. The walk from Chicago St. to the hotel is about 10 - 15 minutes,all this acceptable if your luggage is not heavy. Would be nice to receive a local Chicago newspaper instead of USA Today. Alltogether we think it was a great choice and we will certainly choose the same when back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Hilton standards.”
Reviews.Author: DS62
Reviews.Content: I have never been disappointed with a stay at a Hilton... until now. The location is excellent. The beds were incredibly comfortable. That's where the compliments end. The room was described as "separate living room and bedroom." Well, not so much. It was one large room with a dresser sitting in the middle. The description also stated "two flat screen TVs." There was only one. And it couldn't be turned, so we could only watch TV in bed, not from the sitting area. Saying the sleeper sofa was uncomfortable is a gross understatement. One bonus we experienced: There is a $12.95 per day charge for internet, which was unexpectedly credited back to our account at checkout. Not sure if that's because of Hilton Honors status. Room description only states "internet access" not "complimentary internet access" as is usually the case when it's free. The room was not as clean as I would expect from a Hilton (candy wrappers and earplugs left on the floor). And the carpeting was frayed enough to expose the tack strip in front of the bathroom doorway. The room was not ready for 3:00 check-in. And we couldn't find a bellman for quite some time. No complaints bad enough to ruin our trip, but I won't stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: sdp40206
Reviews.Content: Good stuff : All valet/doormen are VERY friendly and helpful. Feels clean. Excellent location for tourists. Connected to Restaurant / Bar. Safe area. Bad stuff : They charge $15 a day for Internet which is absurd. The pullout beds are incredibly uncomfortable. There are no vending machines in building so if you are thirsty after 9pm when the the little coffee shop/store closes , you are our of luck. Our tv did not work, was told it was broken, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid it”
Reviews.Author: BShishir
Reviews.Content: Too pricy for a small and bland room. Buy drinking water before you enter your room , there is none provided by hotel. If you are a business traveller, well beware of traffic noises till midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: moosh B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in March '11 on a trip from the UK via Cincinnati. I can't comment on value as the room was a gift to us. However, the hotel itself was great - excellent location for two first-time visitors to the Windy City. The staff were helpful but unobtrusive and all areas we saw were clean and tidy. Our room was a little older than I'd expect but perfectly functional. The sitting room area had sofa and 2 chairs, table, large flat screen TV, fridge, sink and desk. The bathroom was spacious and in good order - good shower! The bedroom was equipped with a massive comfortable bed, flat screen TV alarm clock radio and a wee alcove perfect for doing hair and make-up. There was a large wardrobe too. The views were right onto Hancock Tower and with the fog and low cloud, it was very atmospheric! The location worked very well for us and allowed us to see the sights. We really enjoyed our time in Chicago - great shopping, eating and mega-fun times all round. Would recommend Hilton Suites as a base for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: maparso96
Reviews.Content: I am a new Hilton Honors member and was excited for our first stay here. We were two adults and two children and booked a room with two double beds. I ordinarily would not book a room with double beds but selected this hotel based on reviews and the price we got was reasonable for Chicago. We had room 2909 for three nights. The positives: staff were friendly and helpful and the location is very convenient. The negatives: Spa was being renovated, which we weren't told about ahead of time and we were unable to use at all during our stay. I thought it might help with some muscle pain I am having, so was disappointed not to be able to use it. The renovation process made quite a mess of the pool area and it was difficult to maneuver around between that and the very narrow space around the pool already. WI FI only free in the lobby, no fan in the bathroom!!!! Sofa bed extremely uncomfortable, air conditioning system very noisy - some metal panel or something would bang each time the air kicked on and off, keeping us from sleeping well. In the bathroom, there was a big hole around the sprinkler in the ceiling and rough looking panel cut in the ceiling in both the bathroom and bedroom. ( TV in bedroom was not flat screen, not an issue for me, but this seems to bother some people so I am mentioning it. ) Now I know I booked the double beds, and had the sofa bed been reasonably comfortable they might not have been an issue for us, but I have to wonder on the decision to use double beds at all. Double beds might have been ok for two people in the 1700s, but not in this day and age. There is definitely room in the bedroom for queen sized beds if the extra desk is removed (there is already a large desk in the living area). All in all the impression based on our room was of a much cheaper hotel. Not really the standard I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and awesome service...minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: jho61711
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on June 16,17 and 18. We arrived at about noon and booked on priceline. We found out the hotel did not have any available 1king bedroom suite so they gave us basically the same room... Our room was on the 22 floor! it was amazing! the views of JHO and Michgan Ave were awesome and the pool on the 30th floor was awesome! Only issue at the hotel is we did not have a phone book in our room and there were only a few channels...the location was great and thanks for keeping the homeless off the corner :) there were also no vending machines in the building and the starbucks closed at 9 :( at the end of the stay i found store right across from the hotel...overall great stay with minor issues i hope to stay there again in the future! keep up the good work! :):)

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location”
Reviews.Author: HEBS59
Reviews.Content: Graet location if your visiting Chicago. Magnificent Mile 1 block as is the John Hancock buliding. Price was unbelievable and own my own I had a large bedroom plus living room with kitchen 2 flatscreen tvs. A real gem if your first time visitor

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: rod4853
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family (Self, fiancee, 2 small children and my mom). Upon arrival we just did the valet parking. I was $52 for our minivan but it does offer in and out service, most cheaper parking ramps around didn't. The front desk didn't hesitate to honor our request of a 2 bed room since Orbitz had booked a King size room. As a matter of fact, they gave us a suite with a nicely appointed living room and an awesome view on the 29th floor! Location is great and near to eveything. A block away from Michigan Ave and a 10-15 minute walk to Navy Pier. Pool area was clean and user friendly, No lifeguard on site but did have a spa, sauna and 2 fitness rooms too. The view from the pool area was the best in the whole hotel. The staff met our expectations and with the exception of Nancy from the front desk they all had a smile and a nice comment to go along with it. Overall a really nice hotel and would stay here again on a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with large rooms and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: DLT_Wilson
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Chicago from New York, was very pleasantly suprised by the size of the rooms for the price - significantly better than anything we found in NY! Very well equipped, very comfortable and the hotel is well placed at the top end of the Magnificent Mile. Service was excellent - good help from concierge in booking architecture cruise. Probably wouldn't recommend eating in the restuarant attached, which was nothing special - and Chicago has so many other good restaurants on offer. Agree with other reviewer regarding $12.95 for WiFi - excessive (though free in lobby and sometimes still seemed to work back in room when came up from the lobby!) Overall, would ceryainly come back here again. Great value for money on teh deal we got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay and work, good value for your dollar.”
Reviews.Author: Voyta_67
Reviews.Content: I arrived by taxi from the airport very late at night. The reservation was ok, check in without problems. The suite was perfect place to stay and work, good light, very comfortable bed and enough space for me. The small kitchenette worked well, restaurant offerred all I needed and the location is great for all downtown access. Highly recommend to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The employees are exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: parent24
Reviews.Content: Everyone with whom I dealt was helpful and professional. The facility was definitely worth the cost, but the staff made my stay enjoyable. They were knowledgeable about every question I had regarding negotiating the city. Not only were these folks professional, they were friendly, going out of their way to meet my needs and determine the answers to my questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large suite rooms in a great city center location”
Reviews.Author: niknpatel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in April while in Chicago for business and as with most Hilton Hotels that i stay at, this was a pleasant stay. Being a Hilton Honors Silver Gold member, i was upgraded to a higher floor and larger suite that was very spacious and comfortable. Location is great right on the Magnificent Mile where all the boutique and high street shops, restaurants etc are. In regards to nightlife: check out Cuvee, Underground (though the bouncers here are on par if not more arrogant and egotistical than LA & NYC ones!), and my fav club/lounge was Crimson at the Sax Hotel....brilliant! Also check out Lou Milanatis or Geno's East or West for "chicago style pizza"...although NYC pizza is far better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cmcleere
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Tuesday about 2pm. I was able to check in right away. I received a nice room on the 28th floor overlooking the lake. There was a small problem with the room but the manager Carmen Hernandez took care of it. She arranged for a better room on the 21rst floor. She even sent up lunch and gave us breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. This was totally unexpected. The room was large and had a great view. The hotel was clean and we had a great time. The elevator was a little slow but that was it. Will definitely return on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: eli0614
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place but nothing special. We have stayed in just about every hotel in the Mag Mile area and tried this one recently because of price. I asked for a higher floor when booking and was put in the bottom third of floors. Charged $12.95 PER DAY for wireless which I consider to be extremely 2004ish, I mean really...it's free now in most hotels that aren't into nickle and diming it's customers. Room itself was OK but tacky and outdated. It was a King Suite that had a separate bedroom which was tiny. I guess if you're just a business traveler and don't really care about having an experience it's OK but if you're looking for atmosphere and an inner city experience...look elsewhere because this hotel belongs in the suburbs. They also charge $100 deposit PER NIGHT which I felt to be ridiculous

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back Again and Again!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaRyans46580
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights with our 2 boys (age 7 & 9) on a Saturday and Sunday night. We arrived at 1:00 Saturday afternoon and we were able to check in immediately, even though check-in was not until 3. Our bags were brought to our room immediately. Our room was clean and stocked nicely upon check-in. We were able to start letting our boys explore the city within the first hour we were there, which was the point of our trip. We really didn't have any need to contact anyone about issues, as we had none. When we checked out, we were still spending the rest of the day in the city. We checked our bags and when we went back to get them, they were retrieved quickly and easily. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. View from the pool was spectacular! Hotel was very clean. Bed very comfortable. TV in main room a big hit for the boys! Loved having a fridge in room. Only 2 complaints: Sauna was out of service on first day and the pool was freezing! When a 7 & 9 year old have a hard time staying in for longer than 5 minutes, you know it's cold. Not a big enough negative to warrant major complaining since we were there for sightseeing , but the indoor pool was one of the lesser reasons we chose this site, it did detract from the overall stay. Also--skip the $7 bowl of cereal and try the little breakfast/sandwich shop in the Hancock Building. Overall I would rate the stay here 8 out of 10. My 9 year old is helping me write this and he feels his stay was a 9 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel made trip enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: JillinCambria
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for a weekend spring break vacation. I was very pleased with the location of this hotel, especially because we were heading to the American Girl Store and Cafe. This is a perfect location for anyone going there. Also a great location for shopping. I was most disappointed with the pool area. The area itself was chilly and the pool was cold. It did not keep my children away, they still loved it, but I thought it could have been warmer. Also, I would stay away from the hot tub. Management had people leave it to test the pH and it did not look clean. Overall, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.....”
Reviews.Author: GabiGirl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often do dinner and stay downtown just to get away. We have stayed at a number of downtown hotels and for the price we paid this was not worth it. We got a suite and the TV in the bedroom was not working if we wanted to purchase a movie. The TV itself was a big box one from like the 1990's. We called the front desk and they sent someone up just to tell us that there is a problem with the system and they are not sure when it will be corrected. So I guess we had to jsut watch what was on. The room itself was very basic, again for the $ I would recommend the Hyatt or The Drake. The Hilton looked like we were at a ski resort in Wisconsin. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and comfortable suites”
Reviews.Author: Deny_6
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and spacious suites. The beds are very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. I will book again for my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel with just a few words of caution”
Reviews.Author: aisha1601
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago with a young child (8 y/o) and were pretty happy with this hotel for the most part. The facilities were clean - you could tell there'd been recent renovations and the staff was very pleasant. However, there are a few things that families travelling with children may want to be aware of prior to booking a trip here: - Our room was on the 22nd floor and the windows had neither locks nor screens. Our child was old enough not to mess with the windows but I'd be nervous to take a younger child into a room like this. - If you get the one bedroom suite (with adjoining seperate room), the doors have no locks. This more or less defeats the purpose of purchasing this room type and they will not tell you in advance so be sure to ask about it. - The walls were paper thin and we could hear our neighbors' "nocturnal activities" while standing well inside our bedroom packing suitcases. This might not pose a problem for most folks but if your children hear something "odd", you might have some explaining to do. Other than that, you can't beat the location for the price ($89/night for a one-bedroom suite). We could walk to all of the popular tourist attractions plus the resturant within the hotel was pretty good. If you don't want to use the hotel's parking, there are other lots close by. We were able to drive or take a taxi easily to any venue. The hotel is only one block off Michigan Ave so we felt safe walking around at night (although we didn't make a habit of this!).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location - beds are outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JWSchulte
Reviews.Content: overall great - the only issue wihtthe hotel is the $52/day car parking fee - overall the service was great and the employees freindly

Reviews.Title: “Good location, kind of worn rooms”
Reviews.Author: PlannerGeek
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via priceline for a last minute trip to Chicago (3*, River North / Mag Mile, $55). A very good deal for the area. The room was a suite, which is great but we didn't really need so much room. Internet is expensive, I hate to think what parking would cost (we were without a car). The hotel is a little worn, and the cleaning was only kind of OK. Not terrible, but not as good as I usually expect. A reasonable level of service for what we paid, but I might be irked if we had paid full price. Good location, across the street from the Hancock Bldg and right off the Mag Mile. You won't need a car, ~5 min walk to Chicago Ave Red Line station on the El.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwin777
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Hilton Suites Mag Mile to ring in 2011. If you're into shopping on the Mag Mile, the Hilton Suites is at an excellent location. Navy Pier, Downtown, Millennium Park are all very long walks. Taxi's were readily available at the hotel doorstep though. We drove into town, and parking at the hotel was $52 a night. Outrageous, but we knew it ahead of time and budgeted for it. The valet service was very nice and efficient though. The folks at the reception desk were very helpful and friendly. Service to check in and check out was quick. The room was nice, though a bit on the small side, in my opinion, being a suite. There was a living room area with a couch (with a horribly uncomfortable pull out bed), a chair, TV and desk. There was also a small sink and refridgerator. The fridge was contained in a cabinet and didn't work very well. The bathroom was really large. The bedroom was small, but it was spearated by french doors from the living area, which was nice for privacy. Decor was kind of blah and very standard. I expected more from a Hilton in Chicago. We were only given 2 towels each day, and the room attendants replaced our towels even though we had them hanging on the rack, indicating we'd use them again. There were several elevators, though only one or two seemed to be operational. This hotel was ok for our purposes, needing two sleeping areas and some privacy and a decent price for our quick, last minute trip. Though, I was the one "sleeping" on the pull out couch and didn't really sleep. So, yes, a nice stay, nice location for shopping. But, I woudn't really recommend this hotel because of the "suite" factor. Just spring for a second room if you can afford it or be prepared to have a stiff back if you're the one sleeping on the couch. I probably wouldn't stay here on a return trip to Chicago, just because there's so many options and I'd like to try a different location for different activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: amandafrye
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and ended up paying $63 total for the night. I was really surprised when I walked into the room with my 2 daughters. I assumed that the hotel must have made a mistake. The room was HUGE and beautiful. Bathroom was spacious and clean. The staff was so friendly and helpful. There is a huge pool on the 30th floor with huge windows overlooking Lake Michigan. There is an exercise room, massage room, sauna and hot tub. It was very clean. Out of curiosity, I researched the retail price for our type of suite and it was only $125 without any discount. That's a great price. It's Right Next to the John Hancock building. It is a really great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family--not a lot of food choices, however.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilk76
Reviews.Content: The concierge was very helpful with our luggage and calling cabs and such. The lobby is small, busy, and crowded but very well maintained and clean (including the lobby restrooms) I was a little disappointed with the lack of restaurants/ food choices and the room service took forever! The room was very clean, and everything in proper working order. The king bed seemed smaller than a standard king bed, but was still just as comfortable as other Hilton hotels we've stayed at. The pull out sofa works well with our young children, but if you have big kids, you might be better off booking the 2 double bed suite. Close to all shopping near the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Travellinggirl2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off Magnificent Mile, right by all the great shopping and restaurants. The rooms have a bedroom and a living area with wet-bar area and large bathroom. There is a coffee bar in the lobby serving Starbucks coffee, and there is a restaurant/bar as well. The hotel offers parking at $52.00 per night. I liked this hotel as it's warm and cozy and the staff are friendly and helpful. When you check in ask for a lakeview room if you want a nice view. The rate I got was great for a hotel with such a good location and a nice big suite - all Hilton style of course. Unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LKWDEATER
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just a few blocks from the Mile. The staff were very friendly and were especially nice to my kids and my dog. I will stay here on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danboy62
Reviews.Content: Wow...a hard one to review. BBB rating was good. Reviews were iffy due to some complaints. However, I decided to book anyway due to higher rates at other hotels during a sold out time period. I received a wholesale rate through Resorts Plus International even though the area was busy. The only complaint I have is the rooms were a little out dated. But the staff were friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value, two things were GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: StayToday
Reviews.Content: Call me crazy, but a few things seem to stick out to me after a hotel stay. 1..Service. I don need someone sucking up to me, but a human touch means a lot when traveling. The service here was good, valets out front seemed annoyed at my arrival - fellas, sorry to interrupt your little kibbutz here - now can you help with my bag somehow? 2 Shower. Pressure is key, as showerhead performance.. both GREAT at this hotel. Big-time pressure and a working showerhead...wow. Maybe the best pressure I have ever experienced in a hotel. 3 Iron. GREAT again, great iron! Nothing is worse than ironing a white shirt with a iron that has schmutz on it - and ruining the shirt. THis iron was clean, great steam, and had a cord with plenty of length. I liked this place and will stay here again when I return... If I could wich it closer to the blue line - well, it'd be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Large roach!”
Reviews.Author: JDahlTraveller
Reviews.Content: After meeting the very friendly bellhop and front desk clerk, I was looking forward to checking out my room. After putting my suitcase in the closet, I sat on the couch to make a phone call. While I was on the phone, I noticed something moving and looked toward the window. Climbing up the curtain was a large roach. I quickly ended my phone call, got my suitcase, snapped a picture of the roach on my cell phone and quickly headed back down to the front desk. After telling the clerk about it and showing them the picture, it was shown to their supervisor. They went to check the room. In the meantime, I was given a new room. I would have thought the room would have been nicer in order to make up for this embarrassment. However, the room was a mirror image of my first room. After being in the new room for about 10 minutes, I couldn't stop thinking that there would be more bugs (where there's one, there's more - especially with roaches) in the new room. The supervisor said they would be getting back with me. However, they never called back to check on anything or even apologize. I called back to the front desk and said I was not happy with the room. I was finally put in touch with the supervisor. I said I was not comfortable staying in the room (again, just reminded me too much of the other one with the roach). They offered to have someone come and check out the room to make sure there were no bugs. That was something I could have done - and when looking at the vents in the wall that a roach could easily come through, it wouldn't have given me much peace of mind. Therefore, I said that would not help. The only other option they offered was to make a reservation at another hotel. This is what I ended up choosing. No bugs so far at the Millenium Knickerbocker. Overall, instead of the hotel being apologetic, and trying to make up for this HUGE, disgusting issue, I was made to feel like I was a nuisance and that this was nothing out of the ordinary. Due to this lack of interest, it leads me to wonder if this is a normal occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Happy with Stay.”
Reviews.Author: HiltonLover2010
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and Hilton Honors member. I normally stay at the Hilton Palmer House but wanted to be near Northwestern so opted for the Hilton Suites. I was pleasantly surprised with my stay given reviews I had read prior to booking. The staff was very friendly. My suite was on an upper floor, very clean and I was happy with the size and layout. The bedroom, bathroom and living room area were all completely separate rooms with doors. I did not eat at the restaurant or go up to the pool so cannot comment regarding the other amenities. It was nice in the morning to have a small coffee shop available in the lobby area. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others, especially those with children for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms, family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler42256
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms--families with kids ages 6 to 15. Nice, up-to-date rooms. Clean. Nice staff. Super-helpful & friendly bellmen. Was a little nervous making reservations as some family members are used to 5 star top-quality resorts. All of us loved it! Having the extra room in the suite was great. It's not huge, but roomy, especially for a hotel this close to Miracle Mile. Nice pool area. All of us would definitely stay there again! Would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “only good thing is location”
Reviews.Author: rover28
Reviews.Content: For $249 night I had a dank room on a low floor (even though I had booked and paid for a "lake view" room. Hallways are badly lit. Lobby reminds me of a Motel 6. Rooms are not really "suites" -- they just have a bureau with a tv on it that "separates" the room into 2. Lampshades dented and dirty. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinBeach001
Reviews.Content: I originally booked the Drake Hotel for the wrong date so had to cancel that reservation and find a new hotel. I am a Hilton Gold member so I looked at the Hilton Family hotels first. I found this hotel to be right next to The Drake, and on a side street right off the Magnificent Mile. I stayed for literally only 12 hours in Suite 2707 on the 27th floor. The suite had 2 Double beds, a separate living room, and a nice restroom. The suite was comparable to a Embassy Suites room but a little nicer. I had a nice view of Lake Michigan with the complementary upgrade. The room was very clean and large. Check-in was smooth and I had checked-in online and received my breakfast coupons. The next morning I ate my breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant and it was just the normal Hilton breakfast. Overall, this was a nice hotel but I would either stay at the Drake or Palmer House before this one... unless I was bringing my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PLEASEDVISITOR_10
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during Labor Day weekend. This was a great place to stay.
